channel.title: Looking for Experienced Developers/Coders [I'm willing to pay]
channel.description:
I have created a server named DarkScape, and it's based on Matrix 718 server and cache. It's not fully developed yet.
I'm looking for an experienced coders and developers. I'm willing to provide the server's hosing, domain, etc. And I'm also willing to pay.
If you think you can qualify, fill the form below and post your reply.
Name: Age: County: Educational Background: Languages Known: Year's of experience in RSPS developing/coding: Previous RSPS project involved(if any): Number of hours in a day online and willing to work: Can you be trusted if given access to a Dedicated, or trusted with vital information: Do you have experience in Website Design and Development?: Do you agree not to leak the source or any vital information? Email: Contact #:

item.title: Looking for Experienced Developers/Coders [I'm willing to pay]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“cpnm1, post:3, topic:478332”]How is it now?

anyway, thanks for the tip =D[/quote]

Well, you need to remove your Advertisement you’ve edited into the Thread now. You’re welcome for the tip. Why not just copy/paste the sample Application I gave you, instead of picking and choosing things from it/rewording select strings? You’ll probably also want to post exactly what you can ‘bring to the table’ in detail, and also list the compensation you have in mind.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for Experienced Developers/Coders [I'm willing to pay]

item.title: Looking for Experienced Developers/Coders [I'm willing to pay]
item.dc:creator: @cpnm1 cpnm1
item.description:
@cpnm1 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:2, topic:478332”]It’s good that you posted this in the correct section this time. I’m not attempting to flame or demean you in any way, I’m just saying this:

Nobody will take this seriously unless you yourself take this seriously. By this, I mean put work and effort into your recruitment of a Development Team. Simply posting three sentences and buying a public Domain isn’t enough I’m afraid. Sure, you will get a few responses, but they will be from ‘Newbies’ most likely, and won’t have any real talent or knowledge. In other words, in this current state, your R.S.P.S. will fall flat of your expectations, and will probably be labeled as a ‘leech’ like so many others.[/quote]

How is it now?

anyway, thanks for the tip =D

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for Experienced Developers/Coders [I'm willing to pay]

item.title: Looking for Experienced Developers/Coders [I'm willing to pay]
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

It’s good that you posted this in the correct section this time. I’m not attempting to flame or demean you in any way, I’m just saying this:

Nobody will take this seriously unless you yourself take this seriously. By this, I mean put work and effort into your recruitment of a Development Team. Simply posting three sentences and buying a public Domain isn’t enough I’m afraid. Sure, you will get a few responses, but they will be from ‘Newbies’ most likely, and won’t have any real talent or knowledge. In other words, in this current state, your R.S.P.S. will fall flat of your expectations, and will probably be labeled as a ‘leech’ like so many others.

Read full topic
